svg.text: Author: Elaine Cheong and Edward A. Lee

property.name: text
property.value:
A cyclic token-ring system composed of three blocks. This system arbitrates fairly among requests for exclusive access to a shared resource by marching a token around a ring. At each "tick" of the clock, the arbiter grants access to the first requestor downstream of the block with the token.
In this model, InstanceOfArbiter1 starts with the token (see the parameter of the instance).
This example is from: Stephen A. Edwards and Edward A. Lee "The Semantics and Execution of a Synchronous Block-Diagram Language" Technical Memorandum UCB/ERL M01/33, University of California, Berkeley, CA 94720, October 25, 2001.

property.name: text
property.value: Pass in ownership of the token

property.name: text
property.value: Pass in permission to use the token

property.name: text
property.value: If this owns the token and a request is made, then grant access. If this owns the token and no request is made, then pass out permission to use the token. If this does not own the token, but the permission to use the token is passed in, then if a request is made, grant access. In all cases, pass the permission to use the token to the next arbiter.

property.name: text
property.value: Pass out ownership of the token

property.name: text
property.value: Pass out permission to use the token

entity.name: Ramp
entity.doc: Create a sequence of tokens with increasing value
